isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - 12/06/1994 and After - REMOVE AND INSTALL - CONTROL CABLE REPLACEMENT

step1.para: Remove upper driver side defrost trim panel (one screw on top and one on the side) ( Figure 12).
Remove the seven (7) screws that secure the left lower instrument panel cover in place and remove the panel ( Figure 12).

To remove each control cable, it will be necessary to disconnect the defrost control cable from the defrost door in the heater-A/C duct, up under the instrument panel, and the temperature control cable from the Blend-Air door lever on the heater-A/C unit ( Figure 15).
Unsnap the cable(s) from the control actuator and remove.

Feed control cable(s) behind instrument panel to the door it controls. Install the cable on the door lever. Secure the cable to the A/C housing with the plastic adapter on the cable. The defrost setting on the control panel is self adjusting.
Snap the opposite end of the cable in the cable actuator ( Figure 14).
Secure the control panel to the instrument panel with two (2) screws.

If it is necessary to adjust the temperature control knob, turn the knob (center knob on the heater-A/C control panel) ( Figure 14) to full cool mode. The end of the blue color should line up with the index line on the panel ( Figure 14). If it doesn't line up, turn the turnbuckle on the temperature control cable ( Figure 1and Figure 14) until the end of the blue color lines up with the index line on the panel.
Install left lower instrument panel cover with seven (7) screws ( Figure 12).
Install the upper driver side defrost trim panel with one screw on top and one on the side ( Figure 12).
